TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListPopupWindow extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A ListPopupWindow anchors itself to a host view and displays a list of choices.

remarks.para: A ListPopupWindow anchors itself to a host view and displays a list of choices.

ListPopupWindow contains a number of tricky behaviors surrounding positioning, scrolling parents to fit the dropdown, interacting sanely with the IME if present, and others.
See Also

Docs.summary: Returns the view that will be used to anchor this popup.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the view that will be used to anchor this popup.

Sets the popup's anchor view. This popup will always be positioned relative to the anchor view when shown.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.View/IOnTouchListener CreateDragToOpenListener(class Android.Views.View src) cil managed

Docs.param: the view on which the resulting listener will be set
Docs.summary: Returns an that can be added to the source view to implement drag-to-open behavior.

remarks.para: Returns an that can be added to the source view to implement drag-to-open behavior. Generally, the source view should be the same view that was passed to .
When the listener is set on a view, touching that view and dragging outside of its bounds will open the popup window. Lifting will select the currently touched list item.

Control how the popup operates with an input method: one of , , or .
If the popup is showing, calling this method will take effect only the next time the popup is shown or through a manual call to the method.

Docs.summary: To be added.
To be added.
Alias for .

remarks.para: Alias for . If used to specify a popup width, the popup will match the width of the anchor view. If used to specify a popup height, the popup will fill available space.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Modal { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns whether the popup window will be modal when shown.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns whether the popup window will be modal when shown.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set whether this window should be modal when shown.
If a popup window is modal, it will receive all touch and key input. If the user touches outside the popup window's content area the popup window will be dismissed.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool OnKeyDown (Android.Views.Keycode keyCode, Android.Views.KeyEvent e);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnKeyDown(valuetype Android.Views.Keycode keyCode, class Android.Views.KeyEvent e) cil managed

Docs.param: keyCode param passed to the host view's onKeyDown
event param passed to the host view's onKeyDown
Docs.summary: Filter key down events.

remarks.para: Filter key down events. By forwarding key down events to this function, views using non-modal ListPopupWindow can have it handle key selection of items.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool OnKeyPreIme (Android.Views.Keycode keyCode, Android.Views.KeyEvent e);

Docs.param: keyCode param passed to the host view's onKeyPreIme
event param passed to the host view's onKeyPreIme
Docs.summary: Filter pre-IME key events.

remarks.para: Filter pre-IME key events. By forwarding events to this function, views using ListPopupWindow can have it dismiss the popup when the back key is pressed.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
